author: Matt Heilman
title: Winter storm on track to slam Salina, city preparations underway
text:
SALINA, Kan. (KWCH) - Winter will roar into Kansas this weekend, bringing freezing rain and snow that will make driving treacherous across much of the state. The Salina area could see the worst of it.
The forecast for the storm, which is expected to arrive Saturday and continue through Sunday night, shows a band in central Kansas stretching from a little west of Hutchinson, north to about Interstate 70, and east to the Kansas-Missouri line getting ice accumulation of a quarter of an inch up to about half of an inch.
Looking at the snowfall forecast, a band of north-central to northeast Kansas has the highest projected totals of nine to 12 inches of accumulation. Salina braces for impact as the city is in the targeted areas to get the thickest ice and the heaviest snow.
Ahead of the storm, Storm Team 12 Meteorologist Adrian Campa offered the following insight into what Kansans can expect:
“Rain, wintry mix, & widespread snowfall are likely. Major impacts to travel, especially Sunday due to blowing snow, possible major icing, and low visibility are all likely. Power outages are also possible as winds will be gusting over 35mph at times. Now is the time to prepare! We also will have dangerously cold air moving in Sunday night! Please make sure you’re staying up to date on the forecast!”
The City of Salina is making preparations for the storm. This includes salting all of the city’s bridge decks and elevated surfaces.
“Salt trucks are equipped and staff will be on standby ready to deploy when the need arises,” the City of Salina said.
The city advises drivers “to allow ample space when approaching salt trucks from behind, as the equipment will be distributing salt on the roadway.
‘Driving too closely to the equipment could present additional challenges and safety concerns for operators and other motorists,” the City of Salina warned.
For more information on the storm or snow removal operations, Salina advises the public to visit the city’s website at http://www.salina-ks.gov/ , the city’s Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/salina.ks.gov/ or to call its General Services office at 785-309-5750.
Looking at the expected impact on state highways, including Interstate 70, Kansas Highway Patrol Trooper Ben Gardner shared tips on staying safe in the winter weather.
“Being weather aware. I’m doing that, our troopers are doing that, getting your vehicles well prepared for travels, leaving well in advance before the storm arrives,” Gardner said. “If you are needing to travel, really evaluate that, should you be making the trip or could you stay home and just delay?”
In Salina on Thursday, 12 News spoke with a traveler who said he’s prepared and is starting his trip earlier than initially planned to beat the storm as he drives on I-70.
“I’ve got everything. I’ve got blankets and I have a dog, so I got dog food and stuff for cold and food, (a) cooler, the whole bit,” traveler David Keenan said. “I’ve probably got 10 to 12 hours left and I’ll just keep going to make sure that I get there.”
Gardner offered further insight into what the Salina area should look out for with up to a foot of snow on top of a bed of ice.
“It’s going to create some difficulties because we’re going to be working a lot of slide-offs leading up to the snow hitting on top of it, and then when the snow arrives, we’re going to have motorists not realizing there are some slick spots underneath that snow,” he said.
Aside from slick spots, there’s another thing to keep in mind: highway closures.
“I wouldn’t be surprised if we see I-70 shut down,” Gardner said. “When hotels get closed down or filled up and road conditions worsen, they’ll start further eastward, shutting down more and more of the roadway all the way up I-70 and the [Interstate] 135 junction.”
The KHP advises calling STAR 47 if your vehicle breaks down or if you see another vehicle broken down. The highway patrol also stresses the importance of wearing your seatbelt at all times when you’re on the road.
Copyright 2025 KWCH. All rights reserved. To report a correction or typo, please email news@kwch.com

author: Matías Calderón
title: Empieza el juicio al conductor que mató y dijo que era “perseguido por el Diablo”
text: Comienza el juicio oral y público contra Franco Nicolás Cabrera Guevara, el joven que con 19 años hurtó una camioneta jeep Grand Cherokee del taller de cerrajería de su padre y mató en un [siniestro vial](https://www.lavoz.com.ar/opinion/editorial/siniestros-viales-la-responsabilidad-de-conducir/) a un motociclista en barrio General Bustos, en la zona nordeste de la ciudad de Córdoba. La instancia quedó fijada para el día martes a las nueve de la mañana, momento en que el acusado enfrentará a la Cámara Primera del Crimen en un juicio oral y público. El fiscal Andrés Godoy intervino en la pesquisa penal preparatoria que investigó el hecho y que determinó la detención del imputado y estableció su prisión preventiva. Fue quien elevó la causa a juicio. Ahora, durante el debate en la Cámara Criminal, será el fiscal Gustavo Arocena el encargado de mantener la acusación y pedir penas. El 8 de marzo de 2022, Cabrera Guevara atropelló al motociclista Gonzalo Uliana (29), quien acababa de descender de la vereda para transitar por la calle en la intersección de Julio Cortázar y Gino Galeotti. Además embistió a otros autos con la Grand Cherokee que era de una clienta de su papá, de oficio cerrajero del automotor. Había salido desde el taller familiar, ubicado en barrio Ayacucho. Uliana falleció. Cabrera Guevara, al ser abordado por la Policía de Córdoba, repitió en numerosas oportunidades que era perseguido por el Diablo. Fue imputado por homicidio simple con dolo eventual. Para el abogado querellante, Carlos Nayi, el caso marca un precedente “muy importante”. El letrado representa a Rita Yuvich Robledo, la mamá de la víctima, Gonzalo Uliana. “Fue un debate muy interesante el que nos trajo hasta esta instancia porque el acusado, luego de haber embestido a varios vehículos, se bajó diciendo que lo perseguía el Diablo. Dijo también que desde los 14 años tiene problemas de consumo de cocaína, de alcohol y de marihuana en exceso. Por eso se planteó varias veces su imputabilidad o su inimputabilidad. Finalmente, los peritajes de los expertos determinaron que la imputabilidad está disminuida, pero que eso no excluye la valoración de lo que estaba haciendo”, señaló Nayi. La familia de Uliana espera con ansias la instancia judicial. Con el paso del tiempo, y habiendo estado en cuestión la condición de imputabilidad de Cabrera Guevara, hubo momentos muy difíciles que debieron aprender a sobrellevar. La llegada de esta instancia, reconocieron, es “un comienzo para seguir creyendo en la Justicia”. Una travesía sin respeto por la vida Según consta en los expedientes judiciales, el 8 de marzo del año 2022, luego de haberse apoderado ilegítimamente de una camioneta Grand Cherokee, en un descuido de su padre, Cabrera Guevara causó un desastre en la ciudad. El titular del taller donde estaba estacionado el vehículo había quitado un panel y se había retirado del lugar para comprar un repuesto. Al regresar, no habría encontrado a su hijo ni a la camioneta. Siempre según lo investigado, el acusado condujo el vehículo que pertenecía a una clienta de su papá. Lo hizo a más de 200 kilómetros por hora por distintas arterias del barrio General Bustos. No esquivó el epicentro del populoso barrio. Por momentos, anduvo a contramano por la avenida Juan B. Justo. A las 18, cuando se registra un tránsito elevado en la ciudad, terminó embistiendo a ocho vehículos. El primer incidente, se produjo en calle República del Líbano, metros antes de Julián Rodríguez, donde chocó por detrás a un Renault 19 que circulaba en el mismo sentido pero a menor velocidad. Lejos de detenerse y auxiliar a quien había chocado, continuó su marcha y dobló por la calle Julián Cortázar. Usó la bocina en las esquinas, pero nunca aminoró la velocidad. Al llegar a la avenida Juan B. Justo (continuación de la ruta 9 en el interior de la ciudad de Córdoba), giró hacia la derecha. Se trasladó a contramano otros 100 metros por una arteria muy transitada. El expediente describe que los automovilistas que circulaban por la avenida debieron realizar maniobras riesgosas para evitar ser chocados. Al llegar a la siguiente esquina, volvió a ingresar al barrio, esta vez por calle Juez Mármol, por donde continuó a gran velocidad. Pasó a escasos 40 centímetros de un hombre que se encontraba agachado en la calle cambiando una rueda delantera de un vehículo estacionado. Algunos rastros del trayecto son desconocidos. Pero, al llegar por Julio Cortázar a la esquina con Gino Galeotti, atropelló a la motocicleta marca Titán conducida por Uliana, quien acababa de descender de la vereda para transitar por la calle. Fue arrastrado varios metros. “Terminó ocasionándole la muerte. Llega detenido por homicidio simple con dolo eventual, una figura resistida en la Justicia criminal de Córdoba”, remarcó Nayi. Uliana murió, en forma instantánea, por politraumatismos y por traumatismo de cráneo severo. Su cuerpo quedó a 25 metros de la moto, que se incrustó contra una camioneta Ford F100. En ese mismo lugar, el jeep que conducía Cabrera también impactó a un Volkswagen Gol, que provocó un choque en cadena con un Chevrolet Celta, con un Peugeot 208 y con un Fiat 147. También chocó lateralmente con un Renault 9 y con un Chevrolet Classic que estaban estacionados en el lugar. El jeep quedó unos metros más adelante, con el frente destruido, sin el capó y con el velocímetro clavado en 220 kilómetros por hora.

author: Kaitlin Gehlhaus
title: Racing for rehab; Franklin runner to run first Boston Marathon in honor of his father
text:
Racing for rehab; Franklin runner to run first Boston Marathon in honor of his father
FRANKLIN, Mass. (WLNE) — With the Boston Marathon just a month away, runners intensify their preparations.
For one young athlete from Franklin, the race is about much more: it’s a chance to honor a loved one through every stride.
“I sustained a spinal cord injury which left me paralyzed from the chest down at a work accident,” Franklin resident Chad Larivee, father of Liam Larivee, said.
Chad got hurt on a work site job about ten years ago, and his son aims to raise money for the rehab center that helped his father.
Chad served 18 years as a firefighter in Taunton and was on a job helping a fellow firefighter on the day of his accident.
“The ladder went one way and I went the other and that was it,” he explained.
After being treated at Rhode Island Hospital for about two months after the accident, Chad was moved to the Spaulding Rehabilitation Center in Charlestown.
His journey in his new life as a quadriplegic inspired the rest of the family.
“Each one of my children which I have three have all kind of taken a huge interest in my rehab and participated in my new life as we call it,” he said.
With that inspiration, Chad’s son is set to run his first Boston Marathon this year.
All of the money he raised goes to the Spaulding Rehab Center.
“At such a young age, I definitely have so many flash back memories of all the support and care from doctors, nurses, all the physical therapists provided to me and my family at the time, but especially to my father,” Liam said.
The two hope to run together in the Boston Marathon next year, where Liam would push his father for all 26.2 miles.
He previously pushed him in a half marathon in Boston’s Run to Remember race.
“I felt that running for such a great cause would definitely make it more worth it to motivate me through the entire process of months and months of training,” Liam said.
Liam has already raised well over his goal of $7,500 but donations can be made here.

author: Michael Hemsworth
title: Highly Portable Filtration Straws - LifeStraw Sip Filters Bacteria, Microplastics and More (TrendHunter.com)
text:
The LifeStraw Sip water filtration straw is the brand's latest water purification device engineered to provide peace of mind for those looking to clean their water no matter where they are.
The ultra-compact straw is suited for being used just like a conventional reusable straw and has a stainless steel construction for impressive durability. The straw is rated to filter out 99.999% of microplastics, 99.9999999% of bacteria and 99.999% of parasites to provide impressive peace of mind for those looking to enjoy water from a variety of sources or simply from home.
The LifeStraw Sip water filtration straw has an internal membrane microfilter that's rated to filter up to 1,000-liters of water before it needs to be replaced.
LifeStraw Sip Filters Bacteria, Microplastics and More
[Michael Hemsworth](/Michael.Hemsworth)— July 5, 2024 — [Lifestyle](/lifestyle)
References:
lifestraw& thegreenhead
Trend Themes
1. Compact Filtration Devices - The development of ultra-compact filtration devices like the LifeStraw Sip allows for unprecedented portability and convenience in water purification.
2. Reusable Water Purifiers - Reusable water purifiers offer a sustainable alternative to single-use plastic bottles, addressing environmental concerns while ensuring safe drinking water.
3. High-efficiency Microfilters - Advanced microfilter technology showcased in products like the LifeStraw Sip achieves near-perfect filtration levels, setting new standards in health and safety.
Industry Implications
1. Outdoor and Adventure Gear - Innovative filtration straws are transforming the way outdoor enthusiasts can safely consume water in various environments, enhancing their gear options.
2. Personal Health and Safety - The growing demand for personal health solutions creates opportunities for high-quality portable water filtration systems to become household staples.
3. Environmental Sustainability - Products that reduce reliance on single-use plastics, such as reusable water filtration straws, are advancing sustainability efforts within the consumer goods industry.

author: 小浪财讯
title: 电池50ETF（159796）跌0.72%，半日成交额1165.71万元_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，电池50ETF（159796）跌0.72%，报0.554元，成交额1165.71万元。电池50ETF（159796）重仓股方面， 宁德时代 截止午盘跌1.13%， 阳光电源 跌2.96%， 三花智控 涨3.26%， 亿纬锂能 涨0.35%， 格林美 跌0.97%， 欣旺达 跌0.86%， 天赐材料 跌0.53%， 国轩高科 涨0.73%， 德业股份 跌3.78%， 科达利 涨1.92%。
电池50ETF（159796）业绩比较基准为中证电池主题指数收益率，管理人为汇添富基金管理股份有限公司，基金经理为董瑾，成立（2022-03-03）以来回报为-44.25%，近一个月回报为-1.64%。

author: @GdB_it
title: Il presidente del Burundi propone di lapidare gli omosessuali - Giornale di brescia
text: Il presidente del Burundi propone di lapidare gli omosessuali NAIROBI, 29 DIC - Matrimonio omosessuale "pratica abominevole", coppie gay da "lapidare" perché hanno "scelto il diavolo" e attirano la "maledizione" divina. E' la virulenta invettiva del presidente del Burundi Evariste Ndayishimiye pronunciata oggi contro l'omosessualità. Il capo dello Stato di questo Paese cristiano e conservatore - dove le relazioni omosessuali sono punibili fino a due anni di carcere -, è intervenuto nel corso di una conferenza nella provincia di Cankuzo (est), trasmessa dalla radio e dalla televisione, rispondendo alle domande della stampa e della popolazione. "Mi avete posto una domanda su questa pratica abominevole che porta un uomo a sposare un altro uomo e una donna a sposare un'altra donna", ha dichiarato, prima di evocare la Bibbia. "Vi dico la verità, se volete portare una maledizione su un Paese, dovete far sposare persone dello stesso sesso. Vi ricordate cosa è successo a Sodoma e Gomorra? Dio allora disse che si pentiva di aver creato l'uomo", ha aggiunto. - [Leggi qui](https://edicola.giornaledibrescia.it/giornalebrescia/newsstand?int_source=leggiqui&int_medium=link&int_campaing=linkinterno&int_content=leggi_qui_il_gdb_in_edicola_oggi)il GdB in edicola oggi - [Iscriviti alle newsletter del GdB](/newsletter/iscriviti).
